reviews.review_msg: She is okay, but the course is good. If you are good with calculations, take it. At least you will be a bit ready for CFA.

Valerie is a nice person, but some of her explanations on concepts were a bit confusing. I think the concepts of fixed income are difficult and to blame, rather than it being her teaching. Some questions within case studies are too hard, but she marks them leniently.

you wont be able to understand a thing she said in the lecture not because of her accent but because she kept correcting her words every 5 seconds.
AVOID AT ALL COST
